title: "How do Trancing Behaviors Affect Trading Success and Realistic Decision Making?"
first_phrase: In the previous text, the author discusses the importance of being present and in the here and now to function properly in trading. However, many traders act as if they were "hypnotized," mulling over past events and acting on automatic systems. The author explains that the only way to act in a variable market is to be steeped in reality and adapt to it. In the last part (200 tokens), the author explains the different trances that traders may encounter in trading, such as losing contact with reality or progressing into the future, and how these trances can prevent traders from maximizing their function in the market.
content: What it is, however, that takes place precisely? Hypnosis is an alteration of attention, whereas a trance is an alteration of reality wherein your replace certain external realities. The following are the most frequent trances one encounters in trading: 1. Dissociation, i.e. losing contact with the coenesthetic aspect of reality. It essentially denotes the fact that the trader turns hyper-analytical, and accordingly stops trading. He analyses, looks at the graphs times and again, and ceases to be operational. 2. Positive hallucination, which usually coincides with what is called "transference". This transference is directed by traders at the persons of their “gurus”. 3. Progression into the future. In its pathological forms, it corresponds to imaginations having the effect of distancing us from reality, and applies to the trader who is not succeeding in selling because he is stuck in the thought that “he will gain when the stock eventually rises in price”. 4. Daily imaginations, the effect of which is that they freeze us as if in another dimension. This trance consists in the hypnotic dream preventing us from staying in the here and now. 5. last_phrase: In conclusion, being aware of the various trances that traders may experience while trading is crucial for ensuring success in the world of finance. By identifying the signs of dissociation, positive hallucination, progression into the future, daily imaginations, hypermnesia, and temporal distortion, traders can take steps to stay focused and avoid succumbing to the hypnotic dream that can prevent them from achieving their financial goals.
